monitor_button_tooltip:
Start monitoring.
Right double-click to stop, Right triple-click to start
open_image_folder_tooltip: Open the folder where registered images are saved
auto_scale_use_window_tooltip:
ON: Applies the optimal scale obtained from window or search to the template.
OFF: Disables scale correction and always tries recognition with the original image size (1.0x).
auto_scale_desc:
Window Scale Standard:
When the recognition area is set to a window, the scaling factor from its base size is automatically calculated and applied as the scale.
When scaling is active, recognition accuracy may decrease. If image recognition fails, please lower the recognition accuracy threshold.
app_setting_grayscale_desc:
Pros: Faster processing, ignores slight color differences.
Cons: Cannot distinguish images with the same shape but different colors.
app_setting_dxcam_desc:
Pros: Fast capture method with low CPU load, strong for game rendering.
Cons: May not work with some apps or PC environments.
app_setting_eco_mode_desc: If no matching image is found for 5 seconds after a click, shifts to low-frequency monitoring (once per second) to reduce CPU load.
app_setting_frame_skip_desc:
Pros: Increasing the value reduces CPU load.
Cons: Slower reaction to sudden screen changes.
app_setting_opencl_desc:
Pros: Uses the GPU to speed up image processing. Reduces CPU load and improves performance, especially for high-resolution screens or large image recognition.
Cons: May introduce slight overhead for some operations. Compatibility issues with GPU drivers may occur.

[Note] If you encounter instability with errors like amdgpu_cs_query_fence_status failed in Linux environments or when used with certain games, turn this option off.
app_setting_stability_desc:
Detects screen rendering or effects and holds clicks until stable.
Increasing the value considers larger screen changes as 'stable'.
app_setting_lw_mode_desc:
Standard: Default setting (Scale: 0.5x, Skip: +5)
Performance: Higher performance than Standard (Scale: 0.4x, Skip: +20)
Ultra: Tries maximum lightweighting, but may not work in some environments (Scale: 0.3x, Skip: +25)

Note: Enabling Lightweight Mode disables the Auto Scale feature.
item_setting_debounce_tooltip:
When the same image matches consecutively, extends the wait time for the second click to 'Interval + Debounce Time'.
This creates an opportunity for other images with longer intervals to be clicked first.
item_setting_point_click_tooltip: Set a single point on the preview image as the click coordinate.
item_setting_range_click_tooltip: Set a rectangular range on the preview image and click its center or a random position within it.
item_setting_random_click_tooltip: If Range Click is enabled, determines the click coordinate randomly within the range.
item_setting_roi_enable_tooltip:
Enabling ROI (Region of Interest) limits the search target to the specified area.
This allows faster matching and reduces processing load compared to searching the entire screen.

„ÉªFixed: Automatically sets a 200x200 pixel area centered on the click coordinate.
„ÉªVariable: Drag on the preview to set the search area freely.
item_setting_roi_mode_fixed_tooltip: Uses a fixed 200x200 pixel range centered on the set click coordinate as the ROI.
item_setting_roi_mode_variable_tooltip: Drag on the preview to set an arbitrary search range.
item_setting_roi_button_tooltip:
Set the recognition area (ROI) for the image.
While setting, click coordinates and range drawings are relative to the ROI.
Press again to release the setting.
confirm_delete_message:
Really delete %s items (%s)?
(If a folder, all files inside will also be deleted)
base_size_prompt_message:
Window '%s'

Remember the current size of this window as the base size (1.0x)?
apply_scale_prompt_message:
The scale of the recognition area is %sx.
Enable scaling with this factor?

zenity_text: Enter the filename to save (no extension):
folder_dialog_tooltip_image:
Image Recognition Priority Mode Details:
If at least one image in this folder is found on the screen, this folder enters priority mode.
Priority mode is disabled under either of the following conditions:
  • All images in this folder have been clicked once.
  • No images from this folder have been found for the duration of 'Time to disable priority mode'.
folder_dialog_tooltip_timer:
Timer Priority Mode Details:
After the set 'Interval until activation' elapses, only images in this folder will be searched preferentially.
Priority mode is disabled after the 'Time to disable priority mode' elapses.
The activation timer resets when an image in this folder is clicked.

Right Triple-Click to Start
